input:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bear : obj
constant Lion : obj
constant Squirrel : obj
constant Mouse : obj

constant Sees : obj → obj → Prop
constant Visits : obj → obj → Prop
constant Chases : obj → obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Sees Bear Lion
axiom T2 : Visits Bear Lion
axiom T3 : Visits Bear Squirrel
axiom T4 : Chases Lion Bear
axiom T5 : Chases Lion Mouse
axiom T6 : Big Lion
axiom T7 : Sees Lion Squirrel
axiom T8 : Chases Mouse Bear
axiom T9 : Visits Mouse Lion
axiom T10 : Young Squirrel
axiom T11 : Visits Squirrel Lion
axiom T12 : Visits Squirrel Mouse

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Sees x Lion ∧ Kind Lion → Red x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Visits x Lion ∧ Red x → Visits Lion Squirrel
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Sees x Lion
axiom R4 : Visits Lion Squirrel → Chases Lion Bear
axiom R5 : Chases Squirrel Lion → Kind Lion
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Chases x Lion
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Chases x Bear → Big Bear
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Chases x Lion → Kind Lion
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Visits x Bear

theorem lion_does_not_visit_bear : ¬ Visits Lion Bear :=
begin
  sorry,
end
output:
theorem lion_does_not_visit_bear : ¬ Visits Lion Bear :=
begin
  intro H,
  have H1 : Visits Lion Squirrel,
  apply R2 Bear,
  split,
  exact T2,
  apply R1 Bear,
  split,
  exact T1,
  apply R8 Lion,
  exact R6 Lion T6,
  have H2 : Chases Lion Bear,
  exact R4 H1,
  have H3 : Big Bear,
  exact R7 Lion H2,
  have H4 : Chases Bear Lion,
  exact R6 Bear H3,
  have H5 : Kind Lion,
  exact R8 Bear H4,
  have H6 : Sees Bear Lion,
  exact R3 Bear H5,
  have H7 : Red Bear,
  exact R1 Bear ⟨H6, H5⟩,
  have H8 : Visits Bear Bear,
  exact R9 Bear H7,
  have H9 : Visits Lion Bear,
  exact H,
  show false, from
    H9 H8,
end

-- The answer is True
